result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ilee T Burt

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ilee T Burt in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Ilee T Burt.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is requesting plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 30th, 2022

Defendant Ilee T Burt in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Ilee T Burt.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense counsel recently appointed. Defense does NOT have discovery and offer. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ilee T Burt in court.  Jon R Josephsen, along with Madaline Witte under the student practice rule, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/12/2022@1pm
